channel.title: Server Keeps Crashing
channel.description:
I'm running my server on a vps now but i keep getting a crash
# # A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment: # # java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: requested 32756 bytes for ChunkPool::allocate. Out of swap space? # # Internal Error (allocation.cpp:166), pid=50960, tid=41764 # Error: ChunkPool::allocate # # JRE version: 6.0_23-b05 # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (19.0-b09 mixed mode windows-x86 ) # If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit: # http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp # and so on ... please help me

item.title: Server Keeps Crashing
item.dc:creator: @Killerswan Killerswan
item.description:
@Killerswan wrote:

[quote=“velosofy, post:9, topic:380417”][quote author=Ddragonimp link=topic=476244.msg3483166#msg3483166 date=1296342409]
yeah upgrade your 100M to something closer to 536 or 256 Can’t remember the number dont know if they are Specific or not Up that number
Its your maximum Memory.
[/quote]
look closer its 1000M[/quote]

I would guess your problem is a memory leak somewhere in your arrays, my suggestion (Since I have not worked with PI) look around and see if you can find any topics about PI’s memory leak.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Keeps Crashing
item.dc:creator: @Dell Dell
item.description:
@Dell wrote:

[quote=“velosofy, post:1, topic:380417”]I’m running my server on a vps now but i keep getting a crash

A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment:

java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: requested 32756 bytes for ChunkPool::allocate. Out of swap space?

Internal Error (allocation.cpp:166), pid=50960, tid=41764

Error: ChunkPool::allocate

JRE version: 6.0_23-b05

Java VM: Java HotSpot™ Client VM (19.0-b09 mixed mode windows-x86 )

If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit:

http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp

and so on …
please help me[/quote]

Your server requires more memory space than your vps has.
Solution: Get a better vps.

Read full topic
